intro: Pegia nitida, commonly known as the slender pegia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Pegia nitida is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
